body: The width must be `2`, but the height could be `1`. The width of `2` is required, since you won't be able to display 2 width chars in particular, but I'm not sure if height of `1` could break something?

> The width must be `2`, but the height could be `1`. The width of `2` is required, since you won't be able to display 2 width chars in particular, but I'm not sure if height of `1` could break something?

Not sure what would happen if we print a 2 width char when the width is set to be 1. I guess it's acceptable to not display the char or to display only half of it?

Since it's not documented that width/height cannot be lowed than 2, I think this is a case that should be handled better somehow.

If you print 2 wide chars it'll wrap, the point is that when you have only one cell, but you must print wide char, which takes 2 cells. In general, I'd like to limit the terminal size to 2 cells width and 1 cell height. Unless @chrisduerr knows the reason why we have 2 for height as well.

Also, we should set min inner size for a window on resize as well to reflect the fact that we require 2x1 dimensions. The check isn't done upon creation in some cases is certainly a bug.

So the solution could be to expose `MIN_HEIGHT` and `MIN_WIDTH` and also perform `set_min_inner_size` (on a winit window in alacritty in 2 cases: window creation and font change)) with proper sizes calculated from those variables + the user defined padding.

Tried printing a wide char with MIN_SIZE set to be 1. Agreed that we should have term to be at lease 2x1. Not sure whether display size should also be 2x1. I think a display with only one column and displays only half of wide chars is also acceptable, maybe better, so that when a user, for whatever reasons, sets the col number to be 1, they get what they want, instead of having to think of the existence of wide chars to realize there's a limit.

>Tried printing a wide char with MIN_SIZE set to be 1. Agreed that we should have term to be at lease 2x1. Not sure whether display size should also be 2x1. I think a display with only one column and displays only half of wide chars is also acceptable, maybe better, so that when a user, for whatever reasons, sets the col number to be 1, they get what they want, instead of having to think of the existence of wide chars to realize there's a limit.

The thing is that it'll go dsynced for normal chars, since your window is smaller than PTY size, meaning that some chars will be offscreen and you won't be able to ever look at them. So limiting the window size as well is fine and on most systems you have minimal window size larger than 2 * cell.width x 1 * cell.height tbqh.
Why does this need to be changed? It's working exactly as intended. The minimum supported size is 2x2.

The point is that Nx1 dimensions are absolutely fine and I see a use case for that, like 'status bar' wrapped in some application that actually position you like a status bar.

So, I'm in favor to change height to 2x1.

If you don't want to change that we should still restrict dimensions to be at least 2, otherwise user can create a terminal with size of 1x1, since the check is being performed on resize of the window, which in some cases could never happen unless user initiate it.

The other minor thing is about setting min inner size, so the window will be at least to contain our min size, whether it's 2x2 or 2x1.

Does it make sense?

So limiting the window size as well is fine and on most systems you have minimal window size larger than 2 * cell.width x 1 * cell.height tbqh.

Makes sense. Forgot that setting the width to be 2 will make some chars go offscreen...

> Why does this need to be changed? It's working exactly as intended. The minimum supported size is 2x2.

Actually just as @kchibisov said I've been using alacritty as a status bar. Setting the line number to be 1 has been working, and I don't remember seeing in any user-facing documents that the minimum supported size is 2x2. It's quite a surprise for me.

I don't think any of our code relies on the height being at least two, the width certainly must be at least two. Though if someone wants to change it, they should definitely verify that there aren't any edge cases with stuff like selection/line wrapping/reflow.

Generally the 2x2 limit was mostly due to the minimum 2 width requirement, so a minimum height of 1 should work fine.

body: FYI I'm working on a PR for this. Also I realized that a wide char actually only occupies one cell (the other cell is occupied by a `WIDE_CHAR_SPACER`), so we can fairly easily support 1xN in both term and display by not using this `WIDE_CHAR_SPACER`when cols is 1. When doing this only the left half of a wide char will be displayed. Therefore I'm working towards supporting 1x1 so that we have one fewer surprise case. This already works on my machine. I'm now checking and testing for edge cases so that this doesn't break things.

> Therefore I'm working towards supporting 1x1 so that we have one fewer surprise case.

Do not do that. We must not go below 1x2.

> > Therefore I'm working towards supporting 1x1 so that we have one fewer surprise case.
> 
> Do not do that. We must not go below 1x2.

Why? I don't see a reason why we shouldn't support one more case when it's easy enough.
It's not easy enough, there is a lot of code that will be made much more complicated with 1x1 grids.
Thought about it a little bit more. Yeah that's true. That's a case that needs special handling in quite a few places. Okay I'll start working towards 2x1.
